message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bupropion is contraindicated in patients with eating disorders as it has been associated with increased risk of seizures and may decrease the patient's appetite. All other treatment options (cognitive-behavioral therapy, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, and olanzapine) can be used to treat eating disorders.

Cognitive-behavioral therapy, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, and olanzapine are all treatment options for eating disorders.

Bupropion is a medication used to treat depression and it can cause weight loss, which is contraindicated in this patient who is already emaciated due to an eating disorder. Cognitive-behavioral therapy and selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors are both used to treat eating disorders and olanzapine is used to increase appetite, making them all potential treatment options for the patient.
